channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: A Free Update Just Made the PlayStation Portal a Much Better Handheld
item.description: Even if you don't care about streaming, it's a sign of what's to come with the rumored handheld PlayStation 6.

item.title: Apple nears deal to pay Google $1B annually to power new Siri, report says
item.description: Apple is turning to Google's technology to help revamp Siri and power a slate of upcoming features for the voice assistant.

item.title: The best fitness trackers and watches we’ve tested
item.description: Fitness trackers have come a long way from the simple bands that tracked steps and little else. Modern trackers can monitor everything from your heart health to how well you’ve recovered from a hard bout of training. Even flagship smartwatches, which used to be lackluster trackers, have become pretty adept workout companions. Whatever your fitness […]...

item.title: Gemini may be the only way we get the Siri we want, and I'm actually fine with that
item.description: Apple reportedly wants to swap its Siri model work for Gemini's 1 trillion parameter model – and it might be the right move.

item.title: Seemingly Every Horror Filmmaker in Hollywood Agrees: ‘Keeper’ Looks Creepy AF
item.description: Osgood Perkins' latest continues to rack up praise from A-listers, collected in a new trailer that also teases the film's supernatural frights.

item.title: The keyboard of choice for modular synth nerds gets a proper sequel after 10 years
item.description: If you’ve ever watched a synth video on YouTube, there’s a decent chance you’ve seen the Arturia KeyStep at some point. The affordable keyboard and controller has been a steady presence since its release in January of 2016, especially in DAWless circles. Now Arturia is finally releasing a proper successor, the KeyStep mk2, and on […]

item.title: Baseball broke containment during the World Series
item.description: With the swing of a bat, another October came and went for those of us who love baseball. As languid and habitual as the rest of the season can feel, October baseball at its best is pure chaos: Night after night, there's a promise of something new, that you might see something that's never happened […]

item.title: Possible Space Debris Strike Delays Return of Chinese Astronauts From Space Station
item.description: No date has been set for the return of the three-person crew.

item.title: Well, that is awkward - MIT Sloan forced to withdraw "absolutely ridiculous" paper claiming AI played "significant role" in most ransomware attacks
item.description: MIT Sloan retracts paper linking most ransomware to AI after global experts condemn exaggerated claims and lack of credible evidence.

item.title: Apple is planning to use a custom version of Google Gemini for Apple Intelligence
item.description: Apple is preparing to power its AI-upgraded Siri with a custom version of Google’s Gemini AI model, according to a report from Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman. The iPhone maker will reportedly pay Google around $1 billion annually to gain access to the technology, which will generate summaries and perform planning-related tasks. As noted by Bloomberg, Apple […]...

item.title: Des étoiles au moins 1 000 fois plus massives que le Soleil expliqueraient l'énigme des amas globulaires
item.description: Dans notre Voie lactée et les autres galaxies proches, les étoiles ne semblent guère dépasser les 100 masses solaires et, en fait, la très grand majorité des étoiles se trouve sous la forme de naines rouges plus petites que le Soleil. Pourtant, les astrophysiciens pensent depuis longtemps que...

item.title: The nostalgia and surprise of returning to Animal Crossing: New Horizons
item.description: Last week, Nintendo surprised everybody with an announcement: Over four years after its "last major free content update," Animal Crossing: New Horizons is getting a Switch 2 upgrade and a free update for all players. It's not often that an incredibly popular game goes years between updates, but since when has anyone been able to […]

item.title: xAI Employees Were Reportedly Compelled to Give Biometric Data to Train Anime Girlfriend
item.description: What's the opposite of a work perk?

item.title: Amazon’s new Omni QLED TV is now on sale – but I’d look for this better-value model instead on Black Friday
item.description: Amazon has launched its new Omni QLED in time for Black Friday, but it's the brand's mini-LED TV I'd be looking at during Black Friday.

item.title: Postings for this AI job are up 800%
item.description: AI is taking jobs, but it’s creating some, too. Many big companies have cited AI as a reason for recent layoffs. But the new technology transforming the workforce may create some new jobs, too.

item.title: ‘KPop Demon Hunters 2’ Is a Go, But It’s Going to Be a While
item.description: The sequel to Netflix's biggest film of all time is aiming at a 2029 release.

item.title: No, Pro-Trump Hackers Didn’t Hack Zohran Mamdani’s Election Night Party
item.description: X is just a cesspool of disinformation at this point.

item.title: You can now rent a $3000 Nvidia RTX 5090 GPU from just $0.25/hour, when you need it, for as long as you need it
item.description: Renting Nvidia’s $3000 RTX 5090 GPU now costs less than a dollar an hour as decentralized cloud networks provide affordable access to high-end AI hardware.

item.title: Google and Epic end their feud with a deal that changes how Android works
item.description: The settlement allows third-party app stores, new payment options, and capped service fees—if the court signs off. Fortnite maker Epic Games and Google just agreed on a “comprehensive settlement” that could be the final chapter in Epic’s long battle over app store rules.

item.title: Tesla shareholders will vote on whether to make Musk the world’s first trillionaire
item.description: Musk has threatened to walk away from the company if he doesn’t get what he wants. Elon Musk turned off many potential buyers of his Tesla cars and sent sales plunging with his foray into politics. But the stock has soared anyway and now he wants the company to pay him more — a lot more.

item.title: 8BitDo’s latest wireless controllers can now shake-to-wake the Switch 2
item.description: Third-party controller makers that have figured out how to wirelessly wake the Switch 2 from its standby mode are generally loud and proud about that feature. That’s because there still aren’t many controllers that can mimic one of the $89.99 Switch 2 Pro’s biggest selling points, which is letting owners turn the console on from […]

item.title: The Pixel 10 Family Is Marked Down on Amazon
item.description: You can snag a discount on all the Pixel 10 phone varieties if you act fast.

item.title: The Story Behind the Funniest ‘Indiana Jones’ Prop Replica You’ve Ever Seen
item.description: Idols? Whips? Fedora? No way. Regal Robot has made an iconic 'Indiana Jones' clothes hanger.

item.title: Pinterest CEO touts open source AI: ‘tremendous performance’ with reduced costs
item.description: Pinterest CEO Bill Ready says open source AI is offering cost savings to the company, particularly in visual search.

item.title: Meet the Chinese Startup Using AI—and a Small Army of Workers—to Train Robots
item.description: AgiBot is using AI-powered robots to do new manufacturing tasks. Smarter machines may transform physical labor in China.

item.title: Why the flight-disruption chaos could hold the key to ending the shutdown
item.description: The growing matter recalls how the 2019 government closure came to an end. Monday, November 3, saw nearly 5,000 flights delayed in the U.S. The weekend prior saw more than 10,000. Cancellations are stacking up as well.

item.title: Google reportedly blocks 749 million Anna’s Archive URLs
item.description: Google receives more takedown requests for Anna's Archive than any other site.

item.title: Lina Khan to co-chair NYC mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani’s transition team
item.description: Khan's appointment sends a message to the tech industry, whose most powerful players have already been critical of Mamdani, a Democratic socialist.

item.title: Im shocked: Apples M4 MacBook Air has fallen to a new record low of $750 on Amazon
item.description: Amazon has the 13-inch M4 Apple MacBook Air on sale for just $749.99 as of Nov. 5. That's 25% off and its lowest price ever.

item.title: Millions to receive free electricity in 2026 thanks to Australia’s solar boom
item.description: Australia now has so much solar power that the government will require utilities to sell customers free electricity for three hours per day.

item.title: Great gift alert: An adorable Lego Animal Crossing set is 50% off at Macys today
item.description: The Lego Animal Crossing Isabelle's House Visit set is on sale at Macy's for just $19.99 through Nov. 5. That's a 50% savings.
